But the pastoral exterior conceals a dark past and an even darker secret. As a group of individuals  (each with their own ties and agendas with the town and each other) converge on the enclave, strange things begin to happen. Very strange things. I would recommend "Mansfield Park" as a thought-provoking and well-written story about power, loyalty, and betrayal. The movie stars Dame Julia Roberts in the title role, alongside an ensemble cast including Judi Dench, Michael Gambon, and Imogen Twain.
The story follows Fanny Price, who is sent to live with her wealthy uncle Sir Thomas in order to be properly introduced to society. However, as she becomes more involved in the family's affairs, she discovers that their wealth comes at a great cost, including betrayal, manipulation, and violence.
